overview_of_class: Students will be introduced to the technical and theoretical components necessary for media construction: narrative, sound, image, and editing. In addition to a midterm short film script, projects will include a silent short film, a documentary short film and a final narrative short film.
name: Media Construction
title: SoC RTVF 190-0-20 Media Construction

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Students will be introduced to the technical and theoretical components necessary for media construction: narrative, sound, image, and editing. In addition to a midterm short film script, projects will include a silent short film, a documentary short film and a final narrative short film.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will have a working knowledge of the core components, both technical and theoretical, of creating media.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Projects will be evaluated on technical achievement (videography, sound, editing, lighting, and production design) as well as their ability to convey narrative. Engagement in discussion and full attendance will also be taken into account.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
The Visual Story, Second Edition: Creating the Visual Structure of Film, TV and Digital Media
By: Bruce Block
Focal Press, 2008.
ISBN-13: 978-0240807799

CAGE/EQUIPMENT DEPOSIT: $50 cash (refundable)

USB 3.0 portable external hard drive (at least 500 GB recommended)

CLASS NOTES: Students in this course will learn and use the Panasonic HPX camcorder, a Marantz audio recorder and microphones, a basic lighting kit, and Avid Editing.

Students must pay a $50 refundable equipment deposit to the equipment cage in Louis Hall by week 2 of the quarter. This is a pre-requisite for checking out the required equipment for class, as well as using the editing lab.
